alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 8:55PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chase County through 930 PM CST... At 854 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Burdick, or 13 miles west of Strong City, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Bazaar, Elmdale, Matfield Green, Cedar Point, Hymer, Saffordville, Wonsevu, Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 97 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for central and east central Kansas.
